item.title: Still need some experienced help :(
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

In these situations, it all depends on the server. You are going to have to find the .java file that contains the actual hasItem() command. In there you will see something like

private bool/boolen hasItem(int itemId) { //code return true/false }
If that code is remotely correct(above) then the way you would check is like this.

if (c.hasItem(itemId) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(30,npcType); } else { c.getDH().sendDialogues(32,npcType); }Where itemId is the number you would put in to check for the value. No quotes should be used for numbers.

Give that a try, tell me if it works or not.

Read full topic

Also for the item id it would be like this…

case 2639: if (c.hasItem == ITEMID) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(30,npcType); } else { c.getDH().sendDialogues(32,npcType);

If the c.hasItem does not work, try looking for it in the ints.

case 2639: if (I NEED HELP WITH CODE HERE!!) { c.getDH().sendDialogues(30,npcType); } else { c.getDH().sendDialogues(32,npcType);
what do i add in the brackets so that if the player has a certain item in their inventory it says dialogue 30, if they don’t it says dialogue 32…

thanks in advance ladsss
